translations.translation: who play at frivolous games:
Who, ignoring the Reality, engage in pleasantries.
and amuse themselves with vain argumentation.
and who indulged in false disputes against (God's revelations).
Those who are playing in pursuits.
Those who were, in their falsehood, playing.
Those who sport entering into vain discourses.
such as play at plunging,
Who play in talk of grave matters;
who divert themselves with idle chatter:
Those who in wading sport themselves.
—those who play around in vain talk,
That play (and paddle) in shallow trifles.
Who are playing in falsehood.
those who are in plunging, playing.
Those who play with speculation.
Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.
[52:12] those who play around in vain talk, [in] falsehood, that is to say, those who are busily engaged with their disbelief;
(Who play in talk of grave matters) who engage in falsehood;

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { فِي خَوْضٍ يَلْعَبُونَ } معناه في احتلاطِهم، وفتنتِهِم

translations.translation: And His saying, {In a plunging [state] they play.}, its meaning is in their preoccupation, and their trial.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي خَوْضٍ } في الأباطيل الزائغة { يَلْعَبُونَ } [الطور: 12] بآيات الله الدالة على وحدة ذاته وكمال أسمائه وصفاته، وكذا يحلقهم أيضاً ويل عظيم
